title: Suspect in "drive-by" shooting arrested
content:
State police on Tuesday arrested a 19-year old Windham man in connection with a shooting earlier this month that left a teenager in critical condition.
On Nov. 10, troopers responded to 63 Windham Center Road in Windham for a report of a shooting. The incident was initially reported as a drive-by shooting, but further investigation determined the preliminary report was inaccurate, state police said.
On arrival, troopers located the 17-year old Willimantic victim, who the Bulletin is not identifying because of his age, in an upstairs bedroom. The victim was reported to be in critical condition after suffering a gunshot wound to the head.
After an investigation by the Eastern District Major Crimes unit, a warrant was issued for Jeremy McGeowan, of 63 Windham Center Road, police said
McGeowan is charged with unlawful discharge of firearms, tampering with or fabricating physical evidence, second-degree false statement, interfering with an officer, stealing a firearm, first-degree assault and first-degree reckless endangerment.
He was held on a $500,000 bond and is scheduled to appear today at Danielson Superior Court.
